title: Voice of the Mirror: National Lottery 'stitch-up' as cash funds wealthy areas
text:

Most play the lottery in good faith. But how those funds are distributed to good causes is no lottery. It’s a stitch-up.

The bulk of the proceeds go to prosperous towns and cities.

A breakdown of funding by Parliamentary constituency showed Manchester Central got £31.6million in 2015, Barnsley East less than £90,000. Nottingham South got £64.8million but Ashfield, a few miles away, just £930,000.

It has long been suspected that areas which spend most on tickets get the least in grants.

We cannot know for sure because Camelot refuses to say how many lottery tickets are bought in any particular place.

Why would they if it were found that the poorest are paying for arts and sports schemes in already wealthy areas?

Labour’s Tom Watson is right to demand the operator not only reveals where tickets are bought but gives local people a greater say on how the proceeds are spent.

The National Lottery should serve the whole country. At the moment it looks like another tax on the poor.

(Image: PA)

Keep them free

The move to axe free TV licences from the over-75s was “wrong” and “flawed.”

That’s the conclusion of the all-party Commons Digital, Culture, Media and Sport committee. The MPs do not mince their words.

They accuse the Tories of bouncing the BBC into taking responsibility for the benefit.

The committee is right in its analysis and right in its demands.

The party should stick to its manifesto promise and give the BBC the money it needs to restore free TV licences for all those aged 75 and over.

UK rover ticket

Britain is set to join the space race by landing a rover on the Moon in 2021.

And if that goes well it could pave the way for a manned mission to our nearest heavenly neighbour four years later.

You never know, it could be the first place we sign a post-Brexit trade deal with.
description: The bulk of charity proceeds go to prosperous towns and cities, and Labour's Tom Watson is right to demand Camelot reveals where tickets are bought
